post_text: Just a Reminder- There will be no school on Monday, September 7th in observance of Labor Day! Enjoy your weekend!

We are now reporting our internal COVID data at least weekly to the public. You can find the link here: http://bit.ly/vandalscovid

Stay safe and enjoy the Labor Day weekend!

post_text: Good news this evening to share! The USDA announced yesterday that the free meal program has been extended until December 31st. We are able to provide free meals to all students effective immediately.
text: Good news this evening to share! The USDA announced yesterday that the free meal program has been extended until December 31st. We are able to provide free meals to all students effective immediately.

post_text: We are currently having phone bandwidth issues. I am working on this issue, so sorry for the inconvenience this morning.
text: We are currently having phone bandwidth issues. I am working on this issue, so sorry for the inconvenience this morning.

post_text: We will move forward with our hybrid learning model next week based on our updated metrics that I shared yesterday. This is being sent out in response to Fayette County hitting the COVID Warning level today. Thank you for your patience and understanding this week.

post_text: Good afternoon. We will return to our in-person learning in the Hybrid model on Wednesday (8-26). A special thanks to our nurses, staff, and the Fayette County Health Department. Together we can do this. Our students mean the world to us.

post_text:
Please complete the meal request form for Monday and Tuesday before 8:00 a.m on 8-24 if you want to order meals. https://forms.gle/fxqg28rFe9qg3hbc9

Details:
Two meals will be available for pick-up on both Monday and Tuesday during our adaptive pause Remote Learning Days.
Times: 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.
Location: Outside VES/VJHS, VCHS, the old post office in Hagarstown, the church at Vera, old water tower in Shobonier, and the storage shed in Bluff City.
Wednesday hybrid remote learners will receive their meals for Wednesday during the Tuesday distribution.

post_text: We are doing our best to honor in-person learning while being mindful we must have a safe learning environment for all who walk through our doors. My hope & request is that we can find a way to be respectful regardless of opinions. In my heart I know we are #VandalStrong.

post_text: Dear Parents and Guardians. Please read the attached letter. We will be Remote Learning for all on Monday and Tuesday. More information will follow.

post_text:
Just A Reminder if you are an All-In Remote Learner: Chromebook Pick up for Grades K-8 is from 5:30-7:30pm tonight, August 13th under the canopy between VES and VJHS. Please Enter from VETERANS Avenue.

There will be an informational meeting if you are interested in the VES cafeteria. Grades K-3 will be from 6:00-7:00 and grades 4-5 will be from 7:00-8:00 on August 13. Mrs. Philpot, Mrs. Mesnard, and Mr. Holliday will be there to answer your questions and pass out general information about the program.

VCHS All-In Remote Learners can pick up their materials and Chromebooks between 9am - 3pm tomorrow, August 14th in the VCHS office.

You must wear a mask when entering our buildings.
text:
Just A Reminder if you are an All-In Remote Learner: Chromebook Pick up for Grades K-8 is from 5:30-7:30pm tonight, August 13th under the canopy between VES and VJHS. Please Enter from VETERANS Avenue.

There will be an informational meeting if you are interested in the VES cafeteria. Grades K-3 will be from 6:00-7:00 and grades 4-5 will be from 7:00-8:00 on August 13. Mrs. Philpot, Mrs. Mesnard, and Mr. Holliday will be there to answer your questions and pass out general information about the program.

VCHS All-In Remote Learners can pick up their materials and Chromebooks between 9am - 3pm tomorrow, August 14th in the VCHS office.

You must wear a mask when entering our buildings.

post_text: Let go of the stress right now the e-learning and packets might be causing. Instead, let's share our stories on social media how we can do our BEST together. Do this by posting and use #VandalStrong and #ILSchoolsStepUp. We can do this! I know we can.

post_text: Dear Parents- We are experiencing something new to all of us and doing the best we can in this current situation. My ask is do the best you can with the e-learning and packets. Don't get bogged down with the detals such as the 300 minutes or the exact times to sign-in.
text: Dear Parents- We are experiencing something new to all of us and doing the best we can in this current situation. My ask is do the best you can with the e-learning and packets. Don't get bogged down with the detals such as the 300 minutes or the exact times to sign-in.

post_text: Bus riders will be called with the specific time to be at their stop in the morning for lunch pickup. If your student does not ride a bus, you can pick up the lunch from 4 locations between 11:00 a.m to 12:30 p.m. Locations are VJHS, Jefferson, Washington, and Lincoln Schools.

post_text: All delivery orders for the Grab and Go lunch tomorrow are due by noon today. Otherwise parents/guardians will need to pick up at VJHS tomorrow at 11:30 a.m. You can still signup after the deadline (noon today) It will be available the next day (3.18.2020) for delivery.

post_text: The Governor has given the directive/mandate that all schools both public and private will be closed from March 17th to March 30th. We will have school on Monday, March 16th. More details to follow.

post_text: Proud to announce we were awarded a $50,000 School Maintenance Grant today from the IL State Board of Education! This will be applied to one of our summer projects- the Okaw HVAC replacement.

post_text:
ATTENTION ALL PAST HONOR CHORUS MEMBERS:

We are celebrating 38 years of Honor Chorus along with tribute to Carol Osborne. We would like to invite you (any past Honor Chorus member, any age) to sing the final song, "Fight Song" by Rachel Patten, of our performance with the Honor Chorus students this year.
Feel free to join us for practice Friday, May 1st at 4:30pm in the Vandalia Elementary School gym. The performance will be Saturday, May 2nd at 7:00pm in the VES gym.

If you have questions please contact Billie Worker, Nancy Childress or email Lisa Robbins at lrobbins@vandals203.org.

Feel free to join us for practice Friday, May 1st at 4:30pm in the Vandalia Elementary School gym. The performance will be Saturday, May 2nd at 7:00pm in the VES gym.

If you have questions please contact Billie Worker, Nancy Childress or email Lisa Robbins at lrobbins@vandals203.org.

post_text: There will be No School on Friday, November 22nd in order for our students and staff members to attend services for Holly and Jenna. This decision was made based on what we do as a family to support two of our own staff members in their time of need.
